Klasse Rover

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Rover
public class Rover extends greenfoot.Actor
The rover is a movable object that can be controlled by driving and turning. It can also interact with other objects in the world, such as picking up stones and marks and dropping them. It has the ability to check for hills, stones, and markers in its vicinity.
Version:
24 September 2025
Autor:
Paul Jonas Dohle

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Rover

      public Rover()

  • Methodendetails

    • act

      public void act()
      If the button "act" in the main window is clicked this method is executed. The button "run" would execute this method as well, but in a loop.
      Setzt außer Kraft:
      act in Klasse greenfoot.Actor

    • drive

      public void drive()
      The rover moves one field in the direction it is currently facing. If there is a n Object in front of the Rover does not move and displays a message.

    • drive

      public void drive(int amount)
      The rover moves a given amount of steps in the direction it is currently facing
      Parameter:
      amount - The amount of steps to move

    • drive

      public void drive(int amount, Runnable function)
      The rover moves a given amount of steps in the direction it is currently facing. After each step, the given function is executed.
      Parameter:
      amount - The amount of steps to move
      function - The function to execute after each step

    • drive

      public void drive(Callable<Boolean> condition, Runnable function)
      The rover moves until the given condition is false. After each step, the given function is executed.
      Parameter:
      condition - The condition to check
      function - The function to execute after each step

    • drive

      public void drive(Callable<Boolean> condition)
      The rover moves until the given condition is false.
      Parameter:
      condition - The condition to check

    • turn

      public void turn(Direction richtung)
      Thr rover turns 90 degrees in the given direction.
      Parameter:
      richtung - The direction to turn as Enum (RIGHT, LEFT)

    • turn

      public void turn(String direction)
      Thr rover turns 90 degrees in the given direction. This method is only meant to be executed from the GUI directly and not from the code itself. Instead use the method with the Enum parameter to avoid errors. The direction should be one of the following strings: "RIGHT", "right", "rechts", "R", "r" "LEFT", "left", "links", "L", "l"
      Parameter:
      direction - The direction to turn as a string

    • isStoneBelow

      public boolean isStoneBelow()
      The rover checks if there is a Gestein directly below it. If the direction is not correct, a message is displayed.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if there is a `Gestein`, false otherwise

    • isHill

      public boolean isHill(Direction direction)
      The rover checks if there is a "Hill" in the given direction. If the direction is not correct, a message is displayed.
      Parameter:
      direction - The direction to check as Enum (RIGHT, LEFT, FOR)
      Gibt zurück:
      True if there is a "Hill", false otherwise

    • takeStone

      public void takeStone()
      The rover picks up a Stone if there is one directly below it. If there is no Stone, a message is displayed.

    • setMarker

      public void setMarker(boolean forcePlace)
      The rover places a "Marker" object on the current field. If there is already one, the Marker is not placed.
      Parameter:
      forcePlace - If true, the Marker is placed even if there is already one

    • setMarker

      public void setMarker()
      Places a "Marker" object on the current field if there isn't already one.

    • isMarker

      public boolean isMarker()
      The rover checks if there is a "Marker" object on the current field.
      Gibt zurück:
      True if there is a "Marker", false otherwise

    • removeMarker

      public void removeMarker()
      The rover removes a "Marker" object from the current field if there is one.

    • addedToWorld

      protected void addedToWorld(greenfoot.World world)
      Setzt außer Kraft:
      addedToWorld in Klasse greenfoot.Actor
